abusinessl: Glencore PLC is an integrated producer and marketer of commodities, such as metals and minerals, energy products, agricultural products and Corporate and other. The Metals and minerals segment is engaged in copper, zinc/lead, nickel, ferroalloys, alumina/aluminum and iron ore production and marketing. It also has interests in industrial assets that include mining, smelting, refining and warehousing operations. Its Energy products segment includes coal mining and oil production operations and investments in strategic handling, storage and freight equipment and facilities. Its Agricultural products segment is supported by controlled and non-controlled storage, handling and processing facilities in various locations, and is focused on grains, oils/oilseeds, cotton and sugar. Its diversified operations consist of over 150 mining and metallurgical, oil production and agricultural assets. The Company was founded in 1974 and is located in Baar, Switzerland.
tbusinessl: Mutanda Mining SARL is a copper and nickel ore mine operator. Its assets include Mutanda and Kansuki mining concessions in the Katanga region of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The Company is located in Katanga, the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

abusinessl: African Rivers Fund is a private equity fund led by XSML Management BV. It invests in the Democratic Repulic of Congo, Uganda, Republic of Congo, Burundi and Central African Republic, with preferred investment size ranging from USD 0.25 mil to USD 5 mil. It is headquartered in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.
tbusinessl: Maison Galaxy SARL is a cosmetics and other consumer products retailer. It operates eight stores in Kinshasa, Goma, Katanga and Kisangani. The Company was founded in 2014 and is located in Kinshasa, the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

abusinessl: Afriland First Bank is a full service bank, located in Yaound, Cameroon. The Bank operates in Cameroon, Equatorial Guinea and Sao Tome and Principe. Afriland First Bank is an African bank established in several countries of the black continent, in France and China. Founded in 1987 under the name of Caisse Commune d'Epargne et d'Investissement. One of the bank's objectives is to promote the emergence of a new breed of African entrepreneurs and to enhance access of the rural world to the banking system.
